00001 #ifndef MANGLE_OSTREAM_STDIOSERVER_H
00002 #define MANGLE_OSTREAM_STDIOSERVER_H
00003 
00004 #include "../stream.hpp"
00005 #include <iostream>
00006 #include <stdexcept>
00007 
00008 namespace Mangle {
00009 namespace Stream {
00010 
00013 class StdOStream : public Stream
00014 {
00015   std::ostream *inf;
00016 
00017   static void fail(const std::string &msg)
00018   { throw std::runtime_error("StdOStream: " + msg); }
00019 
00020  public:
00021  StdOStream(std::ostream *_inf)
00022    : inf(_inf)
00023   {
00024     isSeekable = true;
00025     hasPosition = true;
00026     hasSize = true;
00027     isWritable = true;
00028     isReadable = false;
00029   }
00030 
00031   size_t write(const void* buf, size_t len)
00032   {
00033     inf->write((const char*)buf, len);
00034     if(inf->fail())
00035       fail("error writing to stream");
00036     // Just return len, but that is ok. The only cases where we would
00037     // return less than len is when an error occured.
00038     return len;
00039   }
00040 
00041   void flush()
00042   {
00043     inf->flush();
00044   }
00045 
00046   void seek(size_t pos)
00047   {
00048     inf->seekp(pos);
00049     if(inf->fail())
00050       fail("seek error");
00051   }
00052 
00053   size_t tell() const
00054   // Hack around the fact that ifstream->tellp() isn't const
00055   { return ((StdOStream*)this)->inf->tellp(); }
00056 
00057   size_t size() const
00058   {
00059     // Use the standard iostream size hack, terrible as it is.
00060     std::streampos pos = inf->tellp();
00061     inf->seekp(0, std::ios::end);
00062     size_t res = inf->tellp();
00063     inf->seekp(pos);
00064 
00065     if(inf->fail())
00066       fail("could not get stream size");
00067 
00068     return res;
00069   }
00070 
00071   bool eof() const
00072   { return inf->eof(); }
00073 };
00074 
00075 typedef boost::shared_ptr<StdOStream> StdOStreamPtr;
00076 
00077 }} // namespaces
00078 #endif
